item.title: Amazon Plans To Open Second Headquarters With 50,000 Jobs
item.description: September 7, 2017 - Amazon is setting out to find a location for a second headquarters, which should touch off intense competition among cities. The new HQ will bring along 50,000 high-paying jobs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 7, 2017 - Amazon is setting out to find a location for a second headquarters, which should touch off intense competition among cities. The new HQ will bring along 50,000 high-paying jobs. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/07/549250141/amazon-plans-to-open-second-headquarters-with-50-000-jobs

item.title: Silicon Valley Wants To Dust Off The Democratic Establishment
item.description: September 7, 2017 - During the Obama years, Democrats got comfortable and Republicans gained a digital advantage. Now, the liberals of Silicon Valley want to change that.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 7, 2017 - During the Obama years, Democrats got comfortable and Republicans gained a digital advantage. Now, the liberals of Silicon Valley want to change that. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/09/07/546700281/silicon-valley-wants-to-dust-off-the-democratic-establishment

item.title: Here's How Big North Korea's Latest Nuclear Test Actually Was
item.description: September 7, 2017 - Seismic and satellite data reveal the test was a whopper, further bolstering the North's claim that it tested a hydrogen bomb.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 7, 2017 - Seismic and satellite data reveal the test was a whopper, further bolstering the North's claim that it tested a hydrogen bomb. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/07/549155856/here-s-how-big-north-korea-s-latest-nuclear-test-actually-was

item.title: How Tech Giants Use Their Power To Advance Corporate Interests
item.description: September 6, 2017 - Big tech companies influence more of our lives than ever before. And there are growing concerns that they're using that power to advance their own corporate interests. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Gizmodo journalist Kashmir Hill about her own experience with the tech giant, Google.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 6, 2017 - Big tech companies influence more of our lives than ever before. And there are growing concerns that they're using that power to advance their own corporate interests. NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Gizmodo journalist Kashmir Hill about her own experience with the tech giant, Google. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/06/548985335/how-tech-giants-use-their-power-to-advance-corporate-interests

item.title: When It Comes To Romantic Attraction, Real Life Beats Questionnaires
item.description: September 6, 2017 - Questionnaires of the sort used by dating apps don't come close to predicting initial attraction compared with meeting someone in real life, a study finds. The ineffable mystery of romance remains.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 6, 2017 - Questionnaires of the sort used by dating apps don't come close to predicting initial attraction compared with meeting someone in real life, a study finds. The ineffable mystery of romance remains. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/06/548645037/when-it-comes-to-romantic-attraction-real-life-beats-questionnaires

item.title: Drones Descend On Houston To Help Assess Damage From Harvey
item.description: September 5, 2017 - In Houston, drones are helping assess damage from Hurricane Harvey. Aarian Marshall from Wired tells NPR's Robert Siegel that this is the first time drones have been used in the U.S. in the management of a major disaster.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 5, 2017 - In Houston, drones are helping assess damage from Hurricane Harvey. Aarian Marshall from Wired tells NPR's Robert Siegel that this is the first time drones have been used in the U.S. in the management of a major disaster. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/05/548715211/drones-descend-on-houston-to-help-assess-damage-from-harvey

item.title: Microsoft President To Trump: To Deport A DREAMer, You'll Have To Go Through Us
item.description: September 5, 2017 - As dozens of CEOs called on the president to preserve DACA, and on Congress to pass an immigration bill to help immigrant youth, the president of Microsoft had some fighting words for the White House.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 5, 2017 - As dozens of CEOs called on the president to preserve DACA, and on Congress to pass an immigration bill to help immigrant youth, the president of Microsoft had some fighting words for the White House. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/05/548686695/250-apple-employees-among-thousands-at-risk-from-daca-cancellation

item.title: Zoë Quinn On #Gamergate
item.description:
September 5, 2017 - The Internet can be a terrible place.

item.title: The Army, The Inventor And The Surprising Uses Of A Batman Machine
item.description: September 5, 2017 - The Army wanted a new, small device that could pull a person rapidly up a rope. The invention they eventually got has uses far beyond the military.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 5, 2017 - The Army wanted a new, small device that could pull a person rapidly up a rope. The invention they eventually got has uses far beyond the military. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/05/545481011/the-army-the-inventor-and-the-surprising-uses-of-a-batman-machine

item.title: What Parts Of The Workforce Might Be Safe From Robots?
item.description: September 4, 2017 - To kick off our series "Is My Job Safe?" NPR's Ari Shapiro asks Erik Brynjolfsson, director of the MIT Initiative on the Digital Economy whether artificial intelligence is threatening our jobs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - To kick off our series "Is My Job Safe?" NPR's Ari Shapiro asks Erik Brynjolfsson, director of the MIT Initiative on the Digital Economy whether artificial intelligence is threatening our jobs. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/04/548505776/what-parts-of-the-workforce-might-be-safe-from-robots

item.title: Scanning The Future, Radiologists See Their Jobs At Risk
item.description: September 4, 2017 - In a new series called "Is My Job Safe?" NPR looks at the future of jobs at a time of rapid gains in artificial intelligence and robotics. We start with a high-paying job in medicine: radiologists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - In a new series called "Is My Job Safe?" NPR looks at the future of jobs at a time of rapid gains in artificial intelligence and robotics. We start with a high-paying job in medicine: radiologists. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/09/04/547882005/scanning-the-future-radiologists-see-their-jobs-at-risk

item.title: So You Want To Buy An Electric Car? It Requires Some Planning
item.description: September 4, 2017 - With new models aimed at the mass market going on sale this fall, Americans will hear a lot more about electric cars. Here's what you should know if you're on the market for one.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - With new models aimed at the mass market going on sale this fall, Americans will hear a lot more about electric cars. Here's what you should know if you're on the market for one. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/04/545593956/so-you-want-to-buy-an-electric-car-it-requires-some-planning

item.title: How Technology Helped Rescuers
item.description:
September 1, 2017 - New technology has played a crucial role in the Houston rescue efforts, as volunteers could communicate to find those in need.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/09/01/547774558/how-technology-helped-rescuers
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Facebook Prepares To Launch New Video Streaming Service
item.description: August 31, 2017 - Facebook is rolling out it's new video streaming service this week. "Facebook Watch" is accessed by a button on the home page feed. Click and you get tons of shows, including a couple of originals. It's paid for by ads, which could be aimed directly at you, since Facebook knows all about you.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: The Smartphone Generation: Less Sex, Fewer Drinks, More Depression
item.description:
August 31, 2017 - A psychologist worries that thousands of young people are "on the brink of a mental health crisis."
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-31/has-the-smartphone-destroyed-a-generation
